result.execSummary:
The disposition of "Other" is used to indicate several different dispositions. The Charge(s)/Sentence(s) and Court Record Events sections of the WCCA record display additional information that must be reviewed in order to determine the exact disposition of the charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Desiree C Roberts in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for competency hearing.  Branch 44 for Branch 21.
Parties stipulate to the doctor's finding that the defendant is not competent, but the State is contesting the doctor's finding that the defendant is not likely to regain competency within the statuatory timeframe.
Hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wisconsin Forensic Unit Psychologist Deborah Collins. Exhibit 1 received.  State and defense rest.  No argument by the State. Defense argument heard. For reasons stated on the record, the Court found that the defendant is not competent at this time, and also found that the defendant is not likely to regain competency within the statuatory timeframe.  Court ordered the proceedings suspended, and ordered that a review hearing on the defendant's competency status be scheduled before Branch 21 pursuant to Wisconsin statute 971.14(6).  All conditions of bail remain the same. 

Exhibit list, Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits, and Order on Competency received and filed.  Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desiree C Roberts in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter transferred to Br. 44 for Hearing.

Defendant Desiree C Roberts in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel did not appear until 9:25 a.m.  Dr. Collins only available to 9:30 a.m.  Notice of situation regarding time frame for Dr. Collin's testimony submitted to all parties on 8/6/15 via email.  Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Desiree C Roberts in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to Court's congested calendar, matter rescheduled for a Hearing.  Defendant's worker in court and new date for this hearing conducted with her.  Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Desiree C Roberts in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr. Collins unavailable today.  Matter recalendared for a Contested Competency Hearing.  Matter calendared with Dr. Collins calendar.  Hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Desiree C Roberts in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests matter continue to a hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
From Dr. Collins received and filed.

Bail motion by defense and state is argued. NO CONTACT ORDER WILL REMAIN THE SAME.
Condition of the NO CONTACT ORDER to be addressed on the next scheduled court date.

Defendant Desiree C Roberts in court with attorney Greg Renden for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Desiree C Roberts
Current: 2735 N. 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 04-24-2015)
Prior: 1112 West Hadley Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Clarence W. or St. Charles Facility at 151 S. 84th Street, Milwaukee

Defendant Desiree C Roberts in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Desiree C Roberts in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Plea WITHHELD as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
